marginalia.translation: It does not live for discourses but for arts. To be spread in the way of pursuits, it does not go for knowledge, but goes astray in vain.

position.marginalia_text: Studere, vt vulgares isti scholastici; non procedere, sed vagari est; non proficere, sed confundere.

marginalia.translation: To study, as those vulgar scholastics; not to advance, but to wander it is; not to accomplish, but to bewilder.
Small balls, without which there is nothing.

position.marginalia_text: Pla[e]riq[ue] docti terunt a[e]tatem, et operam perdunt in varijs eiusdem rei scriptoribus, commentarijs, discursibus, infinitis libroru[m] nugis. Mihi non est opus discursibus: sed uel ipsis artibus, philosophia, professionibus in quotidiam praxi: vel arcanis, stratagematis, technis
Oeconomicis in esse: vel saltem gnomis, apophthegmatis, prouerbijs, epimythijs, epigrammatis,
salibus, qui verè sales. In talibus sententiaru[m], reru[m], operu[m] articulis, nulla temporis
iactura: { Nulla liberalis educatio, Sine Liberalium artium institutione: quicq[ui]d
posteà profitendum, aut negociandum. Propriaru[m] omnium facultatum ille communis apparatus. Et sine hoc generali instructu, qua[e]uis deficit specialis pro[fe]ssio?

marginalia.translation: Many learned people wear out a lifetime and ruin the work of the same matter in various authors, commentaries, discourses, and infinite trifles of books. To me it is not useful for discourses: but either for the arts themselves, for philosophy, and for the professions in their daily praxis: or for secrets, stratagems, and econimic artifices in being: or at least for sayings, aphorisms, proverbs, aftertales, epigrams, and witticism, which truely are witty. In so great parts of opinions, matters, and works, there is no expense of time: there is no education of gentlemanliness without the institution of honorable arts: whatever must ce completed or carried out afterwards. That common preparation of all skills themselves. And without this general equipment, any special profession is left wanting?
